_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Valspar Corporation (Valspar) personnel in Romeoville, Illinois take great pride in maintaining a safe operation for the employees, the community, and the environment. The primary focus is to prevent accidental releases before they occur, while providing systems that minimize any release that does occur and contain it in as small as area as possible.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES: It is Valspar's policy to operate

its plants in a manner that protect its employees, the public, and the environment. It is our policy to adhere

to all applicable federal, state and local laws. The Valspar Romeoville, Illinois facility has a detailed, practiced Emergency Response Plan that is utilized to respond to any accidental releases.



FACILITY DESCRIPTION: The Valspar Romeoville, Illinois facility is a warehouse for storage of architectural and industrial aerosol coatings.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS: The

Romeoville, Illinois Facility has implemented numerous safeguards including Operational Procedures and other accepted good engineering and industry practices. The facility uses both procedural as well as technological systems to ensure safe handling of the architectural and industrial aerosol coatings.



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY: The Valspar Romeoville, Illinois plant has never had an accident involving

architectural and industrial aerosol coatings that resulted in injuries, property damage or environmental releases.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM: In the event of an emergency involving flammable propellants, plant

personnel will notify the Romeoville Fire Department and rely on their expertise to handle the situation. We

have provided the fire department with our Emergency Response Plan and members of the fire department

have inspected the plant. In addition, Valspar has a contract with a qualified emergency response firm to

aid in the cleanup of a release.



PLANNED CHAN

GES TO IMPROVE SAFETY: Valspar has an ongoing and continuing process to audit,

update and review our processes for safety considerations. Valspar currently does not have any planned changes to further safety.
